holidays.name: International Sushi Day 🍣
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the art of sushi-making and indulge in this beloved Japanese delicacy, from classic nigiri to funky rolls.
holidays.origin: Created by sushi enthusiasts and restaurateurs to honor the craftsmanship and cultural significance of sushi worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Sushi dates back over 1,000 years and originally began as a method of preserving fish in fermented rice!

holidays.name: National Splurge Day 💸
holidays.description: An unofficial day to treat yourself without guilt—whether it's that fancy coffee, new gadget, or spontaneous adventure.
holidays.origin: Popularity arose from social media trends encouraging self-care and positive indulgence amidst busy lives.
holidays.funFact: Studies suggest occasional splurging can boost happiness and reduce stress, proving it’s good for your health!

holidays.name: Go Fishing Day 🎣
holidays.description: A quirky day to grab your rod and reel, head outdoors, and enjoy the peaceful (or funny) sport of fishing.
holidays.origin: Started by fishing enthusiasts who wanted a reminder to appreciate nature and the thrill of the catch.
holidays.funFact: The world’s oldest known fishing hook dates back over 23,000 years, showing humans have been fishing for a very long time!

holidays.name: Autistic Pride Day 🧩
holidays.description: A day celebrating the unique qualities and strengths of people on the autism spectrum, promoting acceptance and pride rather than just awareness.
holidays.origin: Originated in 2005 by the autistic community and advocates to promote neurodiversity and self-advocacy.
holidays.funFact: Autistic Pride Day emphasizes that autism is a natural variation of human neurology, not a disease to be cured.
